titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Advertising Paper Dolls collection, 1894-1980 and undated RL.11589
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-04-16 14:58:12 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Collection consists of approximately 400 paper dolls, trade cards, bookmarks and other printed materials that comprised promotional packaging or premium gifts for a variety of products dating from the Victorian era to the 1980s. Dolls depict Mother Goose and other fairy tale and nursery rhyme characters; Victorian men, women and children; animals; occupations; and figures in military, international and ethnic dress. Product classes represented include coffee and other beverages, cotton and linen thread and other sewing supplies, food and patent and nonprescription drugs, Companies represented include A&P, Bendix, Clark's O.N.T., Coca-Cola, Estey Organ, General Mills, Horsman Dolls, J&P Coats, Kellogg, Lion Coffee, McLaughlin Coffee, Morton Salt, Munsingwear, Nestle, Pillsbury, Singer, Western and Southern Life Insurance and Worcester Salt. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Advertising Paper Dolls collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Advertising Paper Dolls collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Richard Collier, Jan. 2018; Accessions described in this collection guide: 2017-0135

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
Cause Marketing Forum. Halo Awards records;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Diamond Information Center Vertical File;

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of approximately 400 paper dolls, trade cards, bookmarks and other printed materials that comprised promotional packaging or premium gifts for a variety of products dating from the Victorian era to the 1980s. Dolls depict Mother Goose and other fairy tale and nursery rhyme characters; Victorian men, women and children; animals; occupations; and figures in military, international and ethnic dress. Product classes represented include coffee and other beverages, cotton and linen thread and other sewing supplies, food and patent and nonprescription drugs, Companies represented include A&P, Bendix, Clark's O.N.T., Coca-Cola, Estey Organ, General Mills, Horsman Dolls, J&P Coats, Kellogg, Lion Coffee, McLaughlin Coffee, Morton Salt, Munsingwear, Nestle, Pillsbury, Singer, Western and Southern Life Insurance and Worcester Salt. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

controlaccess.subject: Advertising
Advertising -- Food
controlaccess.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Adam's Pepsin Tutti Frutti Gum; Ayer's Sarsaparilla (The House that Jack Built); B&B Shoe Store (Pied Piper cut-out story book); Behr-Manning (Daddy Uses Barney's Sandpaper); Bontex Wash Fabrics (Kiddie Kloth Kids); Boraxine; Coca-Cola; Hoyt's German Cologne

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Dolls of All Nations; Dolls Wedding; Double Dolls/Work and Play

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Mammas/Babies/Girls/Boys; Minuet Series; Soldier Boy; Dolls With Hats; Cottonlene Shorten Pie Series

did.unittitle: Corning's Buttercup Ice Cream (Dolls of the Allies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Dwight's Flour; Enterprise Coffee (Mother Goose); F.W. Rueckheim

did.unittitle: Enameline (J.L. Prescott)--Flowers, Ethnic Group; Worcester Salt (Ethnic Group)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Great Atlantic & Pacfic Tea Company (Grandmother's Afternoon Tea); Happy Family Candy (4 Mammas/Babies/Girls/Boys); Honey Nut Cheerios (Annette); Horsman Dollies; KC Baking Powder (Trans-Mississippi and International Exposition 1898); Burnham Company (Burnham Hasty Jellycon); Leinbach (Soldier Doll cards)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Children's Dolls with Stories; Doll House; Nursery Rhymes; Occupations; Riding Brownies; Standing Brownies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Maypole soap; Reid, Murdock Baking Powder (Javanese Coffee Dolls); Gronseth & Olsen's Viking Coffee; McKinney's Blue Ribbon Bread; Cordova Coffee; Mellin's Food; Hulman Crystal Coffee; Minneapolis Garments (Miss Minneapolis); Morton Salt (Umbrella Girl); Munsingwear (Munsingwear Family; Miss Molly Munsing)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Nahn Bakery (Animals); Nestle (France, in French); New England Condensed Mince Meat (Fairy's Children Who Ate the Fairy Pie); Oxford Biscuits (Family; Denmark, in Danish)

did.unittitle: None Such New England Mince Meat (International Dolls)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Panama Coffee (8 Boys and Girls); Pearline (Triplets); Pillsbury; Pozzonis (Bookmark); Estey Organ (Dolls of America and Her New Possessions); Somervilles Pepsin Gum (Spaniard); Washington Crisps (Mother Gooseland); Jacob Hoffman Brewery; Stollwerck's Breakfast Cocoa (Fairy Tale Series); Tonette (Hairbow Set); Twinkles (Dotty Dean Doll)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes W.K. Kellogg; Warner's Brassieres (Dolly's Trunk); Western & Southern Life Insurance; Beecham's Pills (Fairy tale characters); Merrick's Spool Cotton (Head and Shoulder Dolls); Willimantic Thread Co. (Cut-out boy and girl dolls); Singer Sewing Machine (Cut-out female doll)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 4 Mammas/Babies/Girls/Boys; 8 Boys and Girls; 12 Girls 4 Boys; 16 Interchangeable Dolls; 16 Young Ladies; 23 Stand-Up Set; Activity Set; Cape Series; Queens and Nursery Rhymes; Standing Animals with Costumes; Victorian Ladies and Gentlemen; also Dr. Pierce's Favorite Prescription for Weak Women; Kickapoo Indian Pills and Indian Salve; Our Little Girl Chewing Gum
